headline: They Managed 'Dozens Of Credit Cards Responsibly'—Until They Didn't. Now They Owe $177,000 And Can't Find A Way Out. Here's What Happened
summary: A financially overwhelmed Redditor who once had a perfect credit score and juggled multiple credit cards responsibly is now facing more than $177,000 in debt and thinking about bankruptcy. Debt Spiral With No End In Sight In a recent post on r/CRedit, ...

headline: American Express (AXP) Profit Margin Decline Reinforces Slower Earnings Narrative Versus Market Growth
summary: American Express (AXP) posted a net profit margin of 15.8%, slipping from 16.7% a year ago, and full-year earnings growth came in at 3.2%, well below the company’s 16.4% five-year annual average. Looking forward, earnings are forecast to grow at 9.4% per year and revenue at 9.2%, both slower than the US market averages of 15.6% and 10.1% respectively. With the shares trading at 24.1x earnings (above the industry’s 9.8x but below the peer average) and above estimated fair value, current...
